channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcTXY https://t.co/WZKwOrxw7D
Russian troops and tanks pushed into Ukraine and airstrikes hit the country’s capital and more than a dozen other cities https://t.co/jyssSYchRu
The end of the Cold War and years of relative peace in Europe left NATO without a clear mission. Russian aggression has given the alliance a new unity of purpose. https://t.co/pgHlfagXiw

The EU will impose “massive and targeted” sanctions on Russia over its aggression in Ukraine, European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen said. Follow the latest updates https://t.co/vMRgNuJ8AQ

Ukraine's central bank temporarily suspended the country’s currency market, limited the withdrawal of cash and prohibited the issuance of foreign currencies to the general public. Follow the latest updates https://t.co/yQjSHn0uPe
Russia’s central bank has ordered brokers to stop allowing traders to place bets against Russian shares https://t.co/hUwuJkxx6r

Putin’s order to attack Ukraine is his most direct attempt yet to redraw the global security map and restore Russia’s sphere of influence to the days of the Soviet Union and Warsaw Pact https://t.co/rn5oVubmUA
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said he had ordered the introduction of martial law across the country https://t.co/Vd6Nvox8Hv
Western companies with operations in Russia and Ukraine are bracing for the potential impact of fresh sanctions after Putin announced a military operation in Ukraine https://t.co/7yT7A0zk59
Fresh military action in Ukraine ratchets up risks to the country’s gas-transport infrastructure, crucial to European supplies https://t.co/2mLGu2PJVs
Russia’s attack on Ukraine pushed oil prices into triple-digit territory for the first time since 2014 https://t.co/UZ2eXgn5Pp
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcTXY https://t.co/CzScv8iKfL
Ukrainian officials said Russian strikes targeted military installations, airfields and government facilities across the country, as well as border force installations https://t.co/k1dvsPgdSf
President Biden condemned Russia's actions in a phone call with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky. Follow our live coverage here: https://t.co/An85yS1iEi
The U.S. plans to sanction the firm building the Russian-German Nord Stream 2 pipeline. It follows Germany's announcement it would put the project on hold. https://t.co/IltMSgA9rU
Stocks fell, with U.S. futures dropping more than 2%, after Russia invaded Ukraine, and oil topped $100 a barrel for the first time since 2014 https://t.co/7LKy6KGbue
The U.S. and its allies are poised to unveil further sanctions, now that Russia has launched what President Biden called “an unprovoked and unjustified attack” on Ukraine https://t.co/ksI6LA8jy9
President Biden called Putin’s move an unprovoked, unjustified attack in Ukraine, pledging further action against Russia https://t.co/yGZn7IB57r
“The invasion has begun,” a Ukrainian official said, adding that Kyiv has been targeted by missile strikes https://t.co/ErDkGc8Ieq
Breaking: Russian President Vladimir Putin has announced a “special military operation” in the Donbas region of eastern Ukraine https://t.co/K8IgznRJea
Ukrainian airspace has been closed to all civilian aircraft, according to Eurocontrol, which manages European air traffic https://t.co/BmBthgJ4Er
From @WSJopinion: The post-Cold War era is over. The West must adopt a new strategy to protect democracy in Europe. It won’t be easy, writes @BillGalston. https://t.co/GCP2hZv08M

Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau will revoke emergency powers he invoked last week now that police succeeded in shutting down a weekslong protest in Ottawa, according to a person familiar with the matter https://t.co/LsMC3ybZa3
Watch: Dozens of satellite images and videos posted to social media show the Russian military on the verge of attacking Ukraine https://t.co/kPrEYUqPpD
The end of an era? Russia-China collaboration poses the biggest test to America’s global dominance since the Cold War https://t.co/ABI8m7no4B

Russian troops and military equipment have moved out of large visible garrisons in Russia and dispersed into smaller harder to track units, along the northeastern border of Ukraine https://t.co/U5WwgKJ6lU
After years of looking down on lagers, beer snobs are discovering they actually like some of them https://t.co/qQTJ54DHvy
Investors are growing concerned that a Russia-Ukraine conflict could send inflation to new heights as oil trades close to $100 a barrel https://t.co/M58PoEII2x
Life insurers think the deferral of medical treatment during the pandemic contributed to an increase in death-benefit claims not directly tied to Covid-19 https://t.co/tp4Xy22x2o
Russia’s invasion of Ukraine tests President Biden’s leadership on the world stage and among Americans split over the conflict and its potential costs https://t.co/MFnbZplqBK
The end of an era? Russia-China collaboration poses the biggest test to America’s global dominance since the Cold War https://t.co/V14NOmjNDC
From @WSJopinion: Putin doesn’t want to be part of the current international order. He wants to blow it up. It’s depressing to have to say this, but Cold War II is here. https://t.co/YT5hHoKtHD

Ukraine began to mobilize reservists and called on its citizens to leave Russia immediately because of a growing threat of war, a day after the U.S. and several allies announced a broad range of sanctions against Moscow. Follow latest developments. https://t.co/i6zjERHv8Z
From @WSJopinion: Canada’s three-week-old Freedom Convoy is nearly over, writes @michaeltaube. But will Canadian democracy survive Justin Trudeau? https://t.co/PrUwx0PXka
The European Union is planning to sanction Russia’s Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu and Russia’s Internet Research Agency, diplomats said Wednesday https://t.co/27d7evirr9
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/4d1eJC1bt4 https://t.co/b8uTeHxx7b
Ukraine declared a state of emergency and began to mobilize reservists, urging its citizens to leave Russia because of a growing threat of war https://t.co/1qvpLTbhs7
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/TqoXyl5eA4 https://t.co/WsiB6h7snR
Canada has told banks to unlock the bank accounts of people involved in the weekslong Freedom Convoy protest, according to a finance ministry official https://t.co/o6firHhnmt
All eyes are on Russia's threat to Ukraine, but Vladimir Putin's ambitions are much bigger. He wants to muscle Moscow back to the superpower table. https://t.co/CvlR7gVjlt
Cleaning houses, studying chess. How a maid worked her way to a world tournament. “I use it to my advantage. They let their guard down.” https://t.co/ZbzufG0fxm
Carl Icahn has launched a proxy fight for two McDonald’s board seats, people familiar with the matter say, as he pushes the chain over suppliers' treatment of pigs https://t.co/0Y44R5afRC

The Biden administration will take steps to ensure that its sanctions against Russia over Ukraine don't lead to a jump in energy prices–and will act to lower prices if they do, a senior State Department official said Tuesday https://t.co/VfhfjHILwL

Compared by friends to the prodigy in "The Queen's Gambit," one maid in Brazil made her way to a national chess tournament. “People look at me and wonder what the hell I’m doing there.” https://t.co/HXy0V1sifa

Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador, known for his austerity, is at the center of a scandal over his eldest son’s use of a luxury Houston house then owned by an oil executive for a top contractor of Mexico’s state-run oil firm https://t.co/nmxMxhnpjI

2/22/22, or "Twosday" is the first five-digit palindrome in over a decade. The next date to feature a five-digit palindrome with only one number will occur next century, on Jan. 11, 2111, or 1/11/11. https://t.co/gEq03uqtU6
Cleaning houses, studying chess. How a maid worked her way to a world tournament. “I use it to my advantage. They let their guard down.” https://t.co/4JNEUxZsbp
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/nHARsqvEks https://t.co/LncnoHrfmz
The three men who murdered Ahmaud Arbery were found guilty of federal hate crimes. A jury found they targeted him because he was Black. https://t.co/d34k4zBuZ8
The White House called Russia's movement of troops into regions of eastern Ukraine an invasion, a term officials had initially refrained from using https://t.co/X4juMhpyWv
